org.jetel.util.bytes

Class CloverBuffer

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jetel.util.bytes.CloverBuffer
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    DynamicCloverBuffer

    public abstract class CloverBuffer
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is substitution for originally very intensive using of ByteBuffer class. This class is basic container for serialization form of data records (DataRecord). Interface of this class is almost same as ByteBuffer. But our implementation DynamicCloverBuffer ensures that writing to the buffer never throws BufferOverflowException. Buffer easily grows, buffer is elastic.
    See Also:
    only implementation, This class was inspired by similar class from Apache MINA Project

      • allocate

        public static CloverBuffer allocate(int capacity)
        Allocates new clover buffer with given capacity. Buffer is not direct by default.
        Parameters:
        capacity - initial capacity of allocated buffer
        Returns:
        allocated clover buffer instance

      • allocate

        public static CloverBuffer allocate(int capacity,
                    int maximumCapacity)
        Allocates new clover buffer with given capacity. Buffer is not direct by default.
        Parameters:
        capacity - initial capacity of allocated buffer
        maximumCapacity - the limit for inner buffer capacity, buffer expansion is limited
        Returns:
        allocated clover buffer instance

      • allocateDirect

        public static CloverBuffer allocateDirect(int capacity)
        Allocates new direct clover buffer with given capacity. If JVM is out of direct memory, non-direct (heap) memory is used instead.
        Parameters:
        capacity - initial capacity of allocated buffer
        Returns:
        allocated clover buffer instance

        Parameters:

        maximumCapacity - the limit for inner buffer capacity, buffer expansion is limited
        Returns:
        allocated clover buffer instance

      • minimumCapacity

        public abstract int minimumCapacity()
        Returns the minimum capacity of this buffer which is used to determine the new capacity of the buffer shrunk by compact() and shrink() operation. The default value is the initial capacity of the buffer.

      • minimumCapacity

        public abstract CloverBuffer minimumCapacity(int minimumCapacity)
        Sets the minimum capacity of this buffer which is used to determine the new capacity of the buffer shrunk by compact() and shrink() operation. The default value is the initial capacity of the buffer.

      • capacity

        public abstract int capacity()
        See Also:
        Buffer.capacity()

      • capacity

        public abstract CloverBuffer capacity(int newCapacity)
        Increases the capacity of this buffer. If the new capacity is less than or equal to the current capacity, this method returns silently. If the new capacity is greater than the current capacity, the buffer is reallocated while retaining the position, limit, mark and the content of the buffer.

      • maximumCapacity

        public abstract int maximumCapacity()
        Returns maximal capacity of the buffer.

        Turns on or off possibility of relocation underlying buffer at all.

      • expand

        public abstract CloverBuffer expand(int expectedRemaining)
        Changes the capacity and limit of this buffer so this buffer get the specified expectedRemaining room from the current position. This method works even if you didn't set autoExpand to true.

      • expand

        public abstract CloverBuffer expand(int position,
                  int expectedRemaining)
        Changes the capacity and limit of this buffer so this buffer get the specified expectedRemaining room from the specified position. This method works even if you didn't set autoExpand to true.

      • shrink

        public abstract CloverBuffer shrink()
        Changes the capacity of this buffer so this buffer occupies as less memory as possible while retaining the position, limit and the buffer content between the position and limit. The capacity of the buffer never becomes less than minimumCapacity(). The mark is discarded once the capacity changes.

        public abstract CloverBuffer slice()
        See Also:
        WARNING: the resulted slice is shallow copy as requested, but only until first expand of this buffer is performed ISSUE: CL-2597 Recapacity of this CloverBuffer is not allowed.

      • asInputStream

        public abstract java.io.InputStream asInputStream()
        Returns an InputStream that reads the data from this buffer. InputStream.read() returns -1 if the buffer position reaches to the limit.

      • asOutputStream

        public abstract java.io.OutputStream asOutputStream()
        Returns an OutputStream that appends the data into this buffer. Please note that the OutputStream.write(int) will throw a BufferOverflowException instead of an IOException in case of buffer overflow. Please set autoExpand property by calling setAutoExpand(boolean) to prevent the unexpected runtime exception.

      • skip

        public abstract CloverBuffer skip(int size)
        Forwards the position of this buffer as the specified size bytes.

      • normalizeCapacity

        protected static int normalizeCapacity(int requestedCapacity)
        Normalizes the specified capacity of the buffer to power of 2, which is often helpful for optimal memory usage and performance. If it is greater than or equal to Integer.MAX_VALUE, it returns Integer.MAX_VALUE. If it is zero, it returns zero.

      • reallocateByteBuffer

        protected java.nio.ByteBuffer reallocateByteBuffer(int capacity,
                                       boolean direct)
        Request to prepare a new byte buffer.

      • allocateByteBuffer

        protected static java.nio.ByteBuffer allocateByteBuffer(int capacity,
                                     boolean direct)
        Allocates new ByteBuffer instance with given capacity. Resulted ByteBuffer is direct if and only if direct buffer is requested and if usage of direct memory is allowed (Defaults.USE_DIRECT_MEMORY = true) and if free direct memory is still available.
        Parameters:
        capacity - capacity of requested ByteBuffer
        direct - true if direct buffer is requested
        Returns:
        new ByteBuffer
